title: Looking at animals: amphibians
creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Peter Boulton
brief_description: The characteristics of frogs, toads, newts and salamanders are described, compared and contrasted. To illustrate the great variety among amphibians, a European tree frog, a giant toad, an American bullfrog, a fire salamander, a muc-puppy and an axolotl are shown.
creator_credit_for_label: Boulton-Hawker Films, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Peter Boulton
